intro: Odontarrhena nebrodensis subsp. tenuicaulis, commonly known as the slender-stemmed odontarrhena, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in dry, sunny environments. Its small, greenish-white flowers are arranged in umbels, a typical feature of the Apiaceae family. This subspecies is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
